title: Instructional Design Based on Self-Regulated Learning Support Attributes in Blended Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary education field experience and basic digital literacy
context.additional_context: Enhancing instructional design competencies for in-service elementary teachers to improve self-regulated learning in blended learning environments

learning_goals: Learners will explain seven core attributes (Authenticity, Personalization, Learner-control, Scaffolding, Interaction, Reflection Cues, Calibration Cues) that support self-regulated learning in blended learning environments.
Learners will establish a framework for analyzing self-regulated learning support elements in blended learning design by applying literature review methodologies.
Learners will design and evaluate a blended learning model supporting self-regulated learning applicable to elementary education settings.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
